This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=ACADEMICSTUDYSKILLS.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-02-27T11:17:11Z Victoria Higham 2015-02-27T11:06:49+00:00 2015-02-27T11:06:49+00:00 Atmospheres Conference, 1-2 July 2015, University of Manchester - REGISTRATION NOW OPEN https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACADEMICSTUDYSKILLS;477d9da4.1502 Registration is now open for our forthcoming Atmospheres Conference.<br><br>Atmospheres play a significant role in, and add an important quality to, our intimate, domestic and public lives, yet are often overlooked in social research, not least because of the methodological challenges involved in 'capturing' them.<br>In this major conference celebrating the 10th anniversary of the Morgan Centre, we will be using the theme of 'atmospheres' as our starting point for interdisciplinary dialogue. [...] Liv Gunnhild Qvale 2015-02-25T10:32:23+00:00 2015-02-25T10:32:23+00:00 Registration open: The Art and Science of Improvisation, June 2015, Norway https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACADEMICSTUDYSKILLS;9a0981b.1502 The registration is now open for the international research Summer School<br><br>The Art and Science of Improvisation<br><br>Location: Stord/Haugesund University College, Stord, Norway<br><br>Dates: 8th-12th June 2015<br><br>This Summer School is a collaboration between the two research schools NAFOL and Grieg Research School (GRS), and the hosting institution Stord/Haugesund University College (HSH).<br><br>The Summer School will offer a range of stimulating activities, workshops and presentations in addition to the specific GRS course. [...] Sue Chamberlain 2015-02-19T11:33:39+00:00 2015-02-19T11:33:39+00:00 IMPORTANT - amendment JOB VACANCY - Roehampton https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACADEMICSTUDYSKILLS;3b164d2c.1502 Job title: Academic Learning Adviser; part time (21 hours per week)<br><br>Salary: \ufffd\ufffd33,834.00 pa (pro-rated) inclusive of London Weighting Allowance<br><br>The University of Roehampton has a beautiful parkland campus, set in the heart of South-West London, and offers excellent facilities for staff and students.<br><br>The team of Academic Learning Advisers (ALAs) work in collaboration with academic staff within and alongside the curriculum to develop students\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd academic and learning skills. They advise students on approaches and strategies for effective study, information literacy, critical thinking and independent learning. Student guidance is delivered through 1-2-1 tutorials, group workshops, lectures and a range of [...] Sue Chamberlain 2015-02-18T14:05:52+00:00 2015-02-18T14:05:52+00:00 Vacancy - Roehampton University https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACADEMICSTUDYSKILLS;15019fa2.1502 Job title: Academic Learning Adviser (0.6 FTE)<br><br>Salary: \ufffd\ufffd24,758 pa inclusive of London Weighting Allowance<br><br>The University of Roehampton has a beautiful parkland campus, set in the heart of South-West London, and offers excellent facilities for staff and students.<br><br>The team of Academic Learning Advisers (ALAs) work in collaboration with academic staff within and alongside the curriculum to develop students\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd academic and learning skills. They advise students on approaches and strategies for effective study, information literacy, critical thinking and independent learning. Student guidance is delivered through 1-2-1 tutorials, group workshops, lectures and a range of online approaches. We invite you to participate at the 2015 NFEAP summer conference: plenary speakers are now confirmed, and the second call for papers is below.<br><br>NFEAP Summer Conference 2015: Second Call for Papers<br><br>The Norwegian Forum for English for Academic Purposes (NFEAP) is pleased to announce its 9th annual summer conference, which will take place on Thursday the 11th and Friday the 12th of June 2015 at Oslo and Akershus University College of Applied Sciences (H\ufffd\ufffdgskolen i Oslo og Akershus), Oslo, Norway. Completion of CILT or PGCAP will enable participants to gain recognition as Associate and Fellow (respectively) of the Higher Education Academy. Completion of CILT or PGCAP will enable participants to gain recognition as Associate and Fellow (respectively) of the Higher Education Academy. I am confused because I have received an automated response telling me that what I sent was identical to someone else's post and that my response was not processed. But I haven't seen anyone writing a response to this list mentioning [...] Gwyneth Redpath 2014-10-28T11:51:02+00:00 2014-10-28T11:51:02+00:00 Re: Student skills audit TNA https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACADEMICSTUDYSKILLS;4e9c0fb6.1410 ?Did a message get through from me about carrying out a Training Needs Analysis? I am confused because I have received an automated response telling me that what I sent was identical to someone else's post and that my response was not processed. But I haven't seen anyone writing a response to this list mentioning a TNA. I am willing to post again if necessary but I still don't know if or whether my original post got through and why it might be considered identical to one I haven't seen??? [...] Gwyneth Redpath 2014-10-28T10:54:55+00:00 2014-10-28T10:54:55+00:00 Re: Student skills audit https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACADEMICSTUDYSKILLS;40de1dc4.1410 I hesitate to jump in here however, as a former management trainer, this sounds something like the Training Needs Analysis (TNA) carried out before developing a new training course. The aim was to determine the "Training Gap" between "Skills Needed" for a particular piece of work and the "Skills Already in Place". I used to develop my own questionnaire for these TNAs by talking first to those who could already carry out the work, to determine the skills they used in carrying it out, then to the trainees to determine what skills they already possessed. The training course was based [...] Cecile Brich 2014-10-27T11:35:29+00:00 2014-10-27T11:35:29+00:00 Student skills audit https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACADEMICSTUDYSKILLS;35713a9f.1410 Dear All<br><br>We are looking at developing a skills audit for students accessing study skills support, with a view to gauging their needs, helping them reflect on their skills, and forming part of an evaluation of our service.<br><br>Do any of you currently use some form of skills audit?<br>Would you be willing to share your experience of this, and the questions you cover? [...] Yue, Betty Y S 2014-10-01T14:53:56+00:00 2014-10-01T14:53:56+00:00 Re: Short Courses on Business engagement skills in the university context and Open Innovation and creative thinking techniques https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACADEMICSTUDYSKILLS;28b5f825.1410 Dear All,<br>Please could you kindly circulate details of the following courses to your staff, PhDs and postdocs.<br>Thank you<br>Betty Yue<br>Centre for Continuing Professional Development, Imperial College London Kara Ward 2014-09-30T09:16:07-04:00 2014-09-30T09:16:07-04:00 CALL FOR AUTHORS: The SAGE Encyclopedia of Aging: Multidisciplinary Perspectives https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACADEMICSTUDYSKILLS;c4979fd2.1409 CALL FOR AUTHORS: *The SAGE Encyclopedia of Aging: Multidisciplinary<br>Perspectives (this is also open to graduate students)*<br><br>We are inviting academic editorial contributors to *The SAGE Encyclopedia<br>of Aging*, a new multi-volume reference to be published in 2016. *The SAGE<br>Encyclopedia of Aging* includes approximately 1,700 articles organized A-Z<br>in the following categories:<br><br>Abuse and Crimes [...] Nicholas Bowskill 2014-09-22T11:16:42+01:00 2014-09-22T11:16:42+01:00 Group-Situated Reflective Practice, London Workshop https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACADEMICSTUDYSKILLS;ae684af6.1409 Dear All,<br>Some places are still available to explore a new group-level approach to<br>reflective practice. This experiential cross-disciplinary event is taking<br>place at Institute of Education, London on Wednesday 8th October. The<br>workshop explores the shift from metacognition to social metacognition<br>(Frith, 2012).<br><br>Group-Situated Reflective Practice will be introduced as a framework for<br>social metacognition and as an idea in which participants co-construct<br>meaning in their current social context. Workshop participants will also be<br>introduced to a pedagogy for Group-Situated Reflective Practice, called<br>SharedThinking. [...] Liv Gunnhild Qvale 2014-09-15T11:05:43+00:00 2014-09-15T11:05:43+00:00 November 2014: Method course; Data Collection, Interpretation and Analysis, University of Bergen - Norway https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACADEMICSTUDYSKILLS;ae020491.1409 [cid:image002.png@01CFD0E5.C0CFDD50]<br><br>Grieg Research School in Interdisciplinary Music Studies (GRS) invites Ph.D. candidates and other researchers to the autumn 2014 course. This course will focus on methods and methodology as related to the collection of data material and the analysis of data material.<br><br>The Study of Musical Experiences: Data Collection, Interpretation and Analysis [...] Tara Furlong 2014-07-08T12:14:06+01:00 2014-07-08T12:14:06+01:00 Call for Workshop Proposals: Joint Annual Conference 2014 with NIACE, NRDC, RaPAL and UCU https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACADEMICSTUDYSKILLS;bfeaaa2a.1407 Motivated or Mandated: engaging adults in learning and supporting them to succeed<br><br>Joint annual conference to support adults with maths and English<br><br>20th October 2014, UCU Headquarters, London<br><br>Call for Workshop Proposals - deadline 11th August, with post-conference opportunity to submit (multimedia) article for publication in our digital journal for dissemination across all conference participants in addition to RaPAL members. [...] Andrew Edwards 2014-06-16T11:08:41+00:00 2014-06-16T11:08:41+00:00 staff and speaker badge list 16th June.xlsx https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACADEMICSTUDYSKILLS;71908735.1406 Hi Sarah Lou<br><br>Please find attached the staff and speaker list for badges.<br><br>That's a real shame about the OU. I can't think of a replacement off hand, but if I do I'll let you know.<br><br>Best wishes<br>Andrew PBLWorkshop 2014-06-10T16:23:18+00:00 2014-06-10T16:23:18+00:00 REMINDER: Leicester PBL Summer Workshop 2014 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACADEMICSTUDYSKILLS;7d1dd065.1406 Dear Colleague<br><br>You are invited to the 12th LeAP summer workshop on problem based learning (PBL) which will take place in Leicester 7-9 July 2014. Please find further details in the attached flyer and on the web site http://www.physics.le.ac.uk/PBLSummerSchool/ Please pass this invitation on to anyone you know who might be interested. [...] Ilia Xypolia 2014-06-04T16:04:42+01:00 2014-06-04T16:04:42+01:00 The Impact of Urban Education Initiatives on Pupil Learning https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ACADEMICSTUDYSKILLS;57b0c1ec.1406 Education Survey & Research Service in association with Keele University<br><br>25th Anniversary Conference<br><br>The Impact of Urban Education Initiatives on Pupil Learning<br><br>Keele University<br>Friday 4th July 2014<br><br>A survey service at Keele was founded by Tim Brighouse in 1989 to support school improvement initiatives (particularly in urban settings). This service is now operated by the Education Survey & Research Service who, in association with Keele University, will be holding a conference on Friday 4th July 2014 to mark the 25th anniversary of the founding of the service.
